org.midica.ui.tablefilter

Class FilterIcon

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JLabel
            • org.midica.ui.tablefilter.FilterIcon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class FilterIcon
extends javax.swing.JLabel

    This class provides a filter icon for filtering a table. When clicked, it opens a layer where a string filter can be entered.

    Author:
    Jan Trukenm√ºller
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilterIcon

        public FilterIcon(java.awt.Window owner)

        Creates a new icon for showing a table filter on click.

        Parameters:
        owner - The window that contains the icon and the table.

    • Method Detail

      • setTable

        public void setTable(MidicaTable table)

        Sets the table that’s filtered by the filter.

        Parameters:
        table - Table to be filtered.

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean active)

        Changes icon and tooltip according to the filter state.

        An empty filter icon looks different from an active filter.

        Parameters:
        active - false, if the filter is empty, otherwise true.

      • rememberKeyBindingId

        public void rememberKeyBindingId(java.lang.String keyBindingId,
                                 java.lang.String ttType)

        Stores key binding related IDs. These IDs are needed to be able to restore the key binding specific part of the tool tip after the basic tool tip has been changed due to filter changes.

        Parameters:
        keyBindingId - the key binding id
        ttType - the key binding type id

      • addRowSorterListener

        public void addRowSorterListener(javax.swing.event.RowSorterListener listener)

        Adds a RowSorterListener to the row sorter.

        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be added.

      • isFilterLayerOpen

        public boolean isFilterLayerOpen()

        Indicates, if the string filter layer is currently open or not.

        Returns:
        true, if the layer is open, otherwise false;

      • open

        public void open()

        Opens the associated string filter layer.
